text: I didn't choose to be an activist before
2011 I was just a happy mother of two
beautiful girls a dental surgeon not
really engaged with politics
Valentine's Day 2011 that's when it
started
I received the text that people are
gathering at the program about
the wave started from Tunisia then Egypt
and it was a natural thing that it would
come to Bahrain
people said something about there is a
need for a medical tent to treat the
injured protesters
the Pearl Roundabout lasted for a month
and then there was a crackdown
the first few hours they went after the
heads of the political opposition
parties and societies immediately next
day they went after doctors I was the
first female detainee
I was sleep with my husband and my kids
they were in their rooms they're about
to dozens of mask men fully armed and
they told my husband we're here to take
her the first two months I was in
solitary confinement I was beaten all
the time kicked out spit at after the
two months I was released six months
later and we were brought to the
military court that was the first time
when I knew my charges were like
occupying the public hospital
overthrowing the regime inciting hatred
being an agent guns and weapons weapons
and regime overthrowing in it not even
in my world
we were about 50 medical practitioners
at our oath that we will help people
with no discrimination but regardless
any situation
military judge started to read the
charges against us and he came to my
name there was sentence for 15 years he
said a message to the king of Bahrain to
consider release of these medics and all
Co justice in Bahrain they were protests
all over the world people couldn't
believe that this is a country called
Bahrain doing this to its own doctors
after my release I figured out with my
other colleagues we were all subjected
to torture when we were at the prison we
figured out that we have no place to do
rehabilitation for the victims of
torture we decided to establish Bravo
pattern rehabilitation and anti-violence
organization to give the rehabilitation
work to the victims of violence and
torture and their families in my part of
the world people they do not understand
the importance of psychological
rehabilitation so I tried a different
approach I launched channel at the
YouTube giving weekly episodes on how to
deal with life or deal with stress how
do you stand up for yourself
these general topics are designed to
change the mindset of the people if you
are able to stand up for yourself
in front of your parents your partner at
school that definitely you're going to
grow up to be able to stand up for
yourself in front of an abusive regime
I'm thinking of it as process we will
take it gradually till we get the change
we require we have to plant the seeds
now I hope to see it in my lifetime but
if not then I have my children
you
